title: Exploring the Integration of Reinforcement Learning for Enhancing Game Performance: A Comprehensive Review
venue: International Conference on Computing Communication and Networking Technologies
abstract: Reinforcement learning, a subset of machine learning, encompasses the process by which an agent learns through trial-and-error feedback to anticipate its subsequent actions. Its versatility extends across various domains, with gaming being a prominent application. Success in gaming often pivots on the formulation of effective strategies, a task that necessitates repetitive game play, consuming valuable time, energy, and resources. This study aims tointegrate a reinforcement learning agent into gaming scenarios, replicating game dynamics and progressively refining outcomes with each iteration. By mimicking the agentâ€™s performance, human players can augment their likelihood of success. This document highlights the utilization of reinforcement learning techniques, focusing on the application of Value-based methods (Q-learning, Deep Q Network (DQN)), and Model-based methods(State-Action-Reward-State-Action (SARSA)). Q-learning from Value-based methodis designed as an off-policy algorithm, whereas SARSA from Model-based methods functions as anon-policyalgorithm.The outcomes presented encompass insights from previous research on Q-learning and SARSA across diverse test fields or settings. Furthermore, the proposed reinforcement learning methodologies address key facets such as data comprehension, problem categorization, algorithm identification, and algorithm implementation.
